item.title: What does "renderable=false" exactly mean?
item.description:
From uzemelt...@gmail.com on July 31, 2013 10:55:30
In the XML schema documentation for tag-mapping.xml (see https://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/source/browse/mapsforge-map-writer/src/main/resources/tag-mapping.xsd ), the 'renderable' attribute is documented as follows:
"The attribute 'renderable' specifies whether the tag is renderable. Omitting the attribute is interpreted as renderable=true."
and, later:
"Indicates whether the tag is renderable. Omitting the attribute indicates that the tag is renderable."
This is like saying "the name of a person indicates the name of a person". Please document this attribute properly. I don't really understand what it does and when it should be used.
Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=446

item.contents:
From jjbross@gmail.com on January 26, 2014 04:15:10
Status: Accepted Owner: jjbross@gmail.com

From devemu...@gmail.com on October 09, 2014 06:48:35
I think a similar case is also with 'enabled'.
We should update what the src code dictates (default=true), so the value should be changed.
We accept regular patch files and pull requests. The PR are easier for the mirror repository at GitHub: https://github.com/applantation/mapsforge Emux

From devemu...@gmail.com on October 09, 2014 11:21:09
Status: Fixed
